Plasma Frigate.Location: Prime Pier,Pokémon World Tournament,Opelucid City,Route 21,Giant Chasm,P2 Laboratory

Agate Village.Colosseum_Description: A lush, green town that is peacefully populated by old former ace trainers.
Agate Village.Colosseum_Alternate: A lush, green town of senior citizens where there is a relic honoring Celebi.
Agate Village.FRLG_Description: This island has been known by this name since the distant past. No one today knows where it got this name, however.
Agate Village.XD_Description: A lush green town of senior citizens. There is a relic honoring Celebi here.
Agate Village.DP_Description: One of the lakes that is symbolic of the water-rich Sinnoh Region. There is an odd legend associated with it. It is possible to enter the cave underneath the lake from the island in the middle.
Agate Village.Platinum_Description: One of the lakes that is symbolic of the water-rich Sinnoh Region. There is an odd legend associated with it. It is possible to enter the cave underneath the lake from the island in the middle.
Agate Village.HGSS_Description: A town where people and Pokémon live together in simple harmony.
Agate Village.Black_Description: People once lived in this village, and it still feels the same as it did then.
Agate Village.White_Description: People once lived in this village, and it still feels the same as it did then.
Agate Village.Black 2_Description: People once lived in this village, and it still feels the same as it did then.
Agate Village.White 2_Description: People once lived in this village, and it still feels the same as it did then.
Agate Village.XY_Description: This town was known only for its aquarium until the discovery of rare Fossils really put it on the map.
Agate Village.ORAS_Description: This grand resort was built with the aim of allowing Trainers to enjoy every kind of Pokémon battle.
Agate Village.SM_Description: A VLFS or a "very large floating structure". This is where the Aether Foundation's research facilities are.
Agate Village.USUM_Description: A VLFS or a "very large floating structure". This is where the Aether Foundation's research facilities are.
Agate Village.LGPE_Description: The city where people of many generations live together. The department store is located here.
Agate Village.SwSh_Description: A charming town where the people make their homes among the trunks of the towering trees.

Cipher Lab.Colosseum_Description: A sinister and menacing laboratory that was built in the desert without notice.
Cipher Lab.Colosseum_Alternate: A secret lab run by the criminal syndicate Cipher to study and develop Shadow Pokémon.
Cipher Lab.FRLG_Description: A forest on a small islet off the coast of Three Island. Berries grow wildly in profusion, quickly replenishing those that fall off.
Cipher Lab.XD_Description: It appears to be a building. Does it have any ties to Cipher?
Cipher Lab.XD_Alternate:
A factory secretly made by Cipher. Shadow Pokémon links may exist.
The Shadow Pokémon factory that was wrecked by <player>.
Cipher Lab.DP_Description: The square is a place where Trainers can stroll peacefully with Pokémon.
Cipher Lab.Platinum_Description: The square is a place where Trainers can stroll peacefully with Pokémon.
Cipher Lab.HGSS_Description: A place where people from all over come to show off their strength.
Cipher Lab.Black_Description: An ancient tomb that is said to be the resting place of an ancient king.
Cipher Lab.White_Description: An ancient tomb that is said to be the resting place of an ancient king.
Cipher Lab.Black 2_Description: An ancient tomb that is said to be the resting place of an ancient king.
Cipher Lab.White 2_Description: An ancient tomb that is said to be the resting place of an ancient king.
Cipher Lab.XY_Description: Some say the enigmatic device used as a sundial came from outer space.
Cipher Lab.ORAS_Description: A long-sleeping Pokémon will descend upon this cavern in order to awaken its true powers.
Cipher Lab.SM_Description: A grassy stretch along Akala's southern-most coast. It leads from Memorial Hill to the Ruins of Life.
Cipher Lab.USUM_Description: A VLFS or a "very large floating structure". This is where the Aether Foundation's research
Cipher Lab.LGPE_Description: The city where people of many generations live together. The department stor
Cipher Lab.SwSh_Description: Buildings from an age long gone still stand about the steaming hot spring that covers the town.

Mt. Battle.Colosseum_Description: A place of challenging training for all trainers. It is currently held by a sinister gang.
Mt. Battle.Colosseum_Alternate: A place for Pokémon battle training that is always open to all trainer challenges.
Mt. Battle.FRLG_Description: A mysterious cave that is filled with terribly tough Pokémon. It is so dangerous, the Pokémon League is in charge of it.
Mt. Battle.XD_Description: A volcanic island ringed by magma.
Mt. Battle.DP_Description: The Battle Tower—where the best of the best Trainers gather to test their skill—is located here.
Mt. Battle.Platinum_Description: The square is a place where Trainers can stroll peacefully with Pokémon
Mt. Battle.HGSS_Description: A tower that's said to have a legendary Pokémon that lands there.
Mt. Battle.Black_Description: This town offers great views due to its many hills.
Mt. Battle.White_Description: This town offers great views due to its many hills.
Mt. Battle.Black 2_Description: This town offers great views due to its many hills.
Mt. Battle.White 2_Description: This town offers great views due to its many hills.
Mt. Battle.XY_Description: A town that naturally sprang up as people flocked to this pristine riverside.
Mt. Battle.ORAS_Description: New trends are always the rage among the inhabitants of this small island town.
Mt. Battle.SM_Description: A grassy stretch along Akala's southern-most coast. It leads from Memorial Hill to the Ru
Mt. Battle.USUM_Description: A grassy stretch along Akala's southern-most coast. It leads from Memorial Hill to the Ruins of Life.
Mt. Battle.SwSh_Description: A city of great history, living and thriving within castle walls that date back to the middle ages.

Orre Colosseum.Colosseum_Description: A Colosseum in the desert that is known only among the elite.
Orre Colosseum.FRLG_Description: A seemingly plain tunnel that was dug by wild Diglett. It is famous for connecting Routes 2 and 11.
Orre Colosseum.XD_Description: A lively seaport with active trade. Loitering sailors are a common sight.
Orre Colosseum.DP_Description:
A port city that is bisected by a canal. It has a distinctly exotic air of foreign culture.
Head to the library if you want a workout for the mind. Head to the Gym if you just want to work out.
Large ships can always be seen moored at the town's piers.
Orre Colosseum.Platinum_Description: The Battle Frontier--where the best of the best Trainers gather to test their skills--is located here.
Orre Colosseum.HGSS_Description: A path said to always be bathed in sunset, no matter what the season.
Orre Colosseum.Black_Description: A city with a rail yard where trains park for an overhaul.
Orre Colosseum.White_Description: A city with a rail yard where trains park for an overhaul.
Orre Colosseum.Black 2_Description: A city with a rail yard where trains park for an overhaul.
Orre Colosseum.White 2_Description: A city with a rail yard where trains park for an overhaul.
Orre Colosseum.XY_Description: The deep blue ocean off Kalos's coast, where Pokémon from distant lands are said to visit.
Orre Colosseum.ORAS_Description: Ever Grande City: This city is blanketed in a profusion of colorful blooms. It plays host to the grand Pokémon League.
Orre Colosseum.SM_Description: This beautiful path filled with flora connects Iki Town at its north end to Hau'oli City in the south.
Orre Colosseum.USUM_Description: This beautiful path filled with flora connects Iki Town at its north end to Hau'oli City in the south.
Orre Colosseum.LGPE_Description: The town surrounded by waterways. The Water-type Gym is located here.
Orre Colosseum.SwSh_Description: A bustling seaport that many visit to see its lively market stalls and famed restaurant.

Outskirt Stand.Colosseum_Description: A lonely gasoline stand in a desolate desert. Travelers visit it on their journeys.
Outskirt Stand.FRLG_Description: A power plant that was abandoned years ago, though some of the machines still work. It is infested with electric Pokémon.
Outskirt Stand.XD_Description: The peculiar manor that is home to the eccentric scientist Dr. Kaminko.
Outskirt Stand.DP_Description:
A tiny town that preserves the history of Sinnoh and the old ways of life.
In the center of the town is a small shrine that dates to ancient times.
Outskirt Stand.Platinum_Description:
A port city that is bisected by a canal. It has a distinctly exotic air of foreign culture.
Head to the library if you want a workout for the mind. Head to the Gym if you just want to work out.
Large ships can always be seen moored at the town's piers.
Outskirt Stand.HGSS_Description: A mysterious mountain village cut into a rock face.
Outskirt Stand.Black_Description: A modern city of ongoing development that draws people to it.
Outskirt Stand.White_Description: A modern city of ongoing development that draws people to it.
Outskirt Stand.Black 2_Description: A city at the foot of high mountains where you can see all of Unova.
Outskirt Stand.White 2_Description: A city at the foot of high mountains where you can see all of Unova.
Outskirt Stand.XY_Description: This ancient town was once famous for the long-neglected manor home of a noble family.
Outskirt Stand.ORAS_Description: A town formed by scholars who gather to research meteorites.
Outskirt Stand.SM_Description: An area located between Hau'oli City and Route 1. You can catch a whiff of salt on the southerly winds.
Outskirt Stand.USUM_Description: An area located between Hau'oli City and Route 1. You can catch a whiff of salt on the southerly winds.
Outskirt Stand.LGPE_Description: The town at the foot of a volcano. The Pokémon Mansion is located here.
Outskirt Stand.SwSh_Description: An industrial city studded with steam-powered marvels of modern engineering.

Phenac City.Colosseum_Description: A gorgeous jewel of a town that overflows with water in a forbidding desert.
Phenac City.FRLG_Description: An amusement park outside Fuchsia City where many rare Pokémon can be observed in the wild. Catch them in a popular game!
Phenac City.XD_Description: A place for Pokémon battle training that is always open to Trainers.
Phenac City.DP_Description:
An old city that shows fading and almost-forgotten vestiges of ancient history.
A Gym is indispensable in any town that has many people coming and going. This city is no exception.
The Cycle Shop is located here. There is also a big building with a slightly sinister atmosphere.
A statue of an ancient Pokémon is prominently and reverently displayed.
Phenac City.Platinum_Description:
A tiny town that preserves the history of Sinnoh and the old ways of life.
In the center of the town is a small shrine that dates to ancient times.
Phenac City.HGSS_Description: A tower that was hit by lightning, and subsequently caught fire and burned.
Phenac City.Black_Description: A big city with skyscrapers piercing the clouds.
Phenac City.White_Description: A big city with skyscrapers piercing the clouds.
Phenac City.Black 2_Description: A modern city of ongoing development that draws people to it.
Phenac City.White 2_Description: A modern city of ongoing development that draws people to it.
Phenac City.XY_Description: A mysterious void. It is said that nothing can exist within it.
Phenac City.ORAS_Description: The Pokémon that live in this area like to use the steam that erupts from the ground as a sort of bath.
Phenac City.SM_Description: A gladed path filled with the nests of many Pokémon. It leads to the road that can take you to the top of Mount Hokulani.
Phenac City.USUM_Description: A gladed path filled with the nests of many Pokémon. It leads to the road that can take you to the top of Mount Hokulani.
Phenac City.LGPE_Description: A tunnel dug by Diglett connecting Vermilion City to Pewter City.
Phenac City.SwSh_Description: A farming town since days of old, where people and their Pokémon live in close harmony.

Pyrite Town.Colosseum_Description: A rough and dirty town full of thugs and scoundrels. It is said to be home to sinister Pokémon.
Pyrite Town.Colosseum_Alternate: An honorable town of thugs and scoundrels where Shadow Pokémon were once distributed.
Pyrite Town.FRLG_Description: A bewildering cave off the coast of Resort Gorgeous. Some curious thrill seekers have never emerged from it.
Pyrite Town.XD_Description: A Colosseum in the desert that is known only among the elite.
Pyrite Town.DP_Description:
A forest enveloped in chilly air. Thick stands of trees turn the forest into a natural maze.
Deep in the forest is the Old Chateau. It is falling into disrepair after being abandoned by its owner.
Pyrite Town.Platinum_Description:
An old city that shows fading and almost-forgotten vestiges of ancient history.
A Gym is indispensable in any town that has many people coming and going. This city is no exception.
The Cycle Shop is located here. There is also a big building with a slightly sinister atmosphere.
A statue of an ancient Pokémon is prominently and reverently displayed.
Pyrite Town.HGSS_Description: A rich, rainbow colored city where people and Pokémon gather.
Pyrite Town.Black_Description: A tall tower with a large bell whose tones are said to purify the spirit.
Pyrite Town.White_Description: A tall tower with a large bell whose tones are said to purify the spirit.
Pyrite Town.Black 2_Description: A big city with skyscrapers piercing the clouds.
Pyrite Town.White 2_Description: A big city with skyscrapers piercing the clouds.
Pyrite Town.XY_Description: This cave linking Route 7 and Cyllage City is notable for its great hordes of Zubat.
Pyrite Town.ORAS_Description: The people and the Pokémon of this city follow nature's cues to rise each morning and end each day.
Pyrite Town.SM_Description: One of the routes that connects Malie City with the nature surrounding it. This one leads to a rough mountain trail.
Pyrite Town.USUM_Description: One of the routes that connects Malie City with the nature surrounding it. This one leads to a rough mountain trail.
Pyrite Town.LGPE_Description: A town where many people and Pokémon gather. The Safari Zone is located here.
Pyrite Town.SwSh_Description: This rocking town has a punk vibe and streets crammed with shops lined up cheek by jowl.

Realgam Tower.Colosseum_Description: The construction site for an immense tower, which will have a Colosseum on the top floor.
Realgam Tower.Colosseum_Alternate:
An immense tower that was finally completed as Cipher's base. It has a Colosseum on top.
An immense tower that was finally completed. It is said to have a suspended Colosseum.
Realgam Tower.FRLG_Description: A mystical mountain that is known for its frequent meteor falls. The shards of stars that fall here are known as Moon Stones.
Realgam Tower.XD_Description: A lonely gas station in the desert. Travelers stop by on their journeys.
Realgam Tower.DP_Description:
A tiny port town where Trainers who love battling more than eating gather.
The gateway to the Battle Park is located here.
Moored at the pier is the ferry to Snowpoint City.
Realgam Tower.Platinum_Description:
A forest enveloped in chilly air. Thick stands of trees turn the forest into a natural maze.
Deep in the forest is the Old Chateau. It is falling into disrepair after being abandoned by its owner.
Realgam Tower.HGSS_Description: A cave that had collapsed once. It has been reconstructed.
Realgam Tower.Black_Description: Trainers seeking further strength enter the cavern despite the risks.
Realgam Tower.White_Description: Trainers seeking further strength enter the cavern despite the risks.
Realgam Tower.Black 2_Description: Iron bars around the exits were dismantled, drawing curious Trainers.
Realgam Tower.White 2_Description: Iron bars around the exits were dismantled, drawing curious Trainers.
Realgam Tower.XY_Description: An exclusive resort area made popular thanks to its clear skies and mild atmosphere.
Realgam Tower.ORAS_Description: This cavern is famous for its cave art, which depicts events from thousands of years ago.
Realgam Tower.SM_Description: A route full of rugged boulders that present a difficult challenge to anyone who hopes to pass through it.
Realgam Tower.USUM_Description: A route full of rugged boulders that present a difficult challenge to anyone who hopes to pass through it.
Realgam Tower.LGPE_Description: A plateau where the Pokémon League stands towering above all else.
Realgam Tower.SwSh_Description: A vibrant town that has grown up around an ancient mural tucked away in the mountains.

Snagem Hideout.Colosseum_Description: The former base of Team Snagem that was completely destroyed in a catastrophic explosion.
Snagem Hideout.FRLG_Description: A decrepit, burned-down mansion on Cinnabar Island. It got its name because a famous Pokémon researcher lived there.
Snagem Hideout.XD_Description: A gorgeous, oasis-like city that is targeted by Cipher.
Snagem Hideout.XD_Alternate: A gorgeous city in the desert that overflows with bounteous water.
Snagem Hideout.DP_Description:
A town of flower lovers, Floaroma Town is always perfumed with the sweet scent of flowers.
A short, floral pathway opens up to a sprawling sea of flowers in bloom.
In the center of town is the flower shop called Pick a Peck of Colors.
Snagem Hideout.Platinum_Description:
A tiny port city where Trainers who love battling more than eating gather.
The gateway to the Battle Frontier is located here.
Moored at the pier is the ferry to Snowpoint City.
Snagem Hideout.HGSS_Description: A beautiful city with flowing water and blooming flowers.
Snagem Hideout.Black_Description: A cave where electrically charged stones float.
Snagem Hideout.White_Description: A cave where electrically charged stones float.
Snagem Hideout.Black 2_Description: They say the deepest part of the cave leads to the Sinnoh region.
Snagem Hideout.White 2_Description: They say the deepest part of the cave leads to the Sinnoh region.
Snagem Hideout.XY_Description: The railway brings people from great distances to see the huge, majestic falls.
Snagem Hideout.ORAS_Description: This grassy path running between Littleroot Town and Oldale Town is perfect for doing fieldwork.
Snagem Hideout.SM_Description: A route considered by many to be a place to take a break before taking on Haina Desert.
Snagem Hideout.USUM_Description: A route considered by many to be a place to take a break before taking on Haina Desert.
Snagem Hideout.LGPE_Description: A technological complex where Electric-type Pokémon are commonly found.
Snagem Hideout.SwSh_Description: A town nestled within the nurturing bowl of our many terraced farming fields.

The Under.Colosseum_Description: A wholly lawless underground town that is ruled by the criminal syndicate Cipher.
The Under.Colosseum_Alternate: An underground town freed of Cipher, and where the Kid Network is now active.
The Under.FRLG_Description: A tower that houses the graves of countless Pokémon. Many people visit it daily to pay their respects to the fallen.
The Under.XD_Description: A rough and rocky Poké Spot where wild Pokémon appear.
The Under.DP_Description: A speck of an island far from any civilization. It is covered in an abundance of flowers.
The Under.Platinum_Description:
A town of flower lovers, Floaroma Town is always perfumed with the sweet scent of flowers.
A short, floral pathway opens up to a sprawling sea of flowers in bloom.
In the center of town is the flower shop called Pick a Peck of Colors.
The Under.HGSS_Description: A city where you can smell small flowers and a sea breeze.
The Under.Black_Description: It is a popular place for tourists, but too harsh to be a resort.
The Under.White_Description: It is a popular place for tourists, but too harsh to be a resort.
The Under.Black 2_Description: A tall tower with a large bell whose tones are said to purify the spirit.
The Under.White 2_Description: A tall tower with a large bell whose tones are said to purify the spirit.
The Under.XY_Description: A city nestled between the cliffs and the sea, overlooked by steep Bicycle racecourses.
The Under.ORAS_Description: Many Trainers gather on this route in the hope of encountering Pokémon in the wild.
The Under.SM_Description: An old route that leads to a trial site. Its beach is famous for its unique black sand.
The Under.USUM_Description: An old route that leads to a trial site. Its beach is famous for its unique black sand.
The Under.LGPE_Description: A calm country road full of greenery.
The Under.SwSh_Description: Our quiet borough is home to the esteemed Pokémon Research Lab.

Description.HGSS_Description: Four islands that are protected by whirlpools and are difficult to reach.

Celadon City.GSC_Slogan: Where People and Pokémon Live in Happy Harmony!
Celadon City.RS_Slogan: A tiny island in the blue sea.
Celadon City.Emerald_Slogan: A tiny island in the blue sea.
Celadon City.ORAS_Slogan: A tiny island in the blue sea.

Cerulean City.RBY_Slogan: A Mysterious, Blue Aura Surrounds It
Cerulean City.RS_Slogan: The paradise of flowers, the sea, and Pokémon.
Cerulean City.FRLG_Slogan: A Mysterious, Blue Aura Surrounds It
Cerulean City.Emerald_Slogan: The paradise of flowers, the sea, and Pokémon.
Cerulean City.XY_Slogan: The starry city marking the hours.
Cerulean City.ORAS_Slogan: The paradise of flowers, the sea, and Pokémon.
Cerulean City.LGPE_Slogan: The Fiery Town of Burning Desire

Cinnabar Island.RBY_Slogan: The Fiery Town of Burning Desire
Cinnabar Island.RS_Slogan: A farm community with small gardens.
Cinnabar Island.FRLG_Slogan: The Fiery Town of Burning Desire
Cinnabar Island.Emerald_Slogan: A farm community with small gardens.
Cinnabar Island.B2W2_Slogan: A city that reaches for the sky.
Cinnabar Island.ORAS_Slogan: A farm community with small gardens.

Fuchsia City.GSC_Slogan: A Mysterious, Blue Aura Surrounds It
Fuchsia City.RS_Slogan: The treetop city that frolics with nature.
Fuchsia City.Emerald_Slogan: The treetop city that frolics with nature.
Fuchsia City.XY_Slogan: A town where you can taste the ages.
Fuchsia City.ORAS_Slogan: The treetop city that frolics with nature.

Indigo Plateau.RBY_Slogan:
The ultimate goal of Trainers!
The highest Pokémon authority!
Indigo Plateau.GSC_Slogan: The City of Cute, Fragrant Flowers
Indigo Plateau.RS_Slogan: Pokémon Center Hot Springs An excellent place for relaxing!
Indigo Plateau.FRLG_Slogan:
The ultimate goal of Trainers!
The highest Pokémon authority!
Indigo Plateau.Emerald_Slogan: Pokémon Center Hot Springs An excellent place for relaxing!
Indigo Plateau.BW_Slogan: Sky Glittering with Flowers of Snow
Indigo Plateau.XY_Slogan: The city where bay and butte are bound.
Indigo Plateau.ORAS_Slogan: Pokémon Center Hot Springs An excellent place for relaxing!

Lavender Town.GSC_Slogan: A Port Surrounded by Rough Seas!
Lavender Town.RS_Slogan: Where the land ends and the sea begins.
Lavender Town.Emerald_Slogan: Where the land ends and the sea begins.
Lavender Town.ORAS_Slogan: Where the land ends and the sea begins.

Pallet Town.GSC_Slogan: The Fiery Town of Burning Desire
Pallet Town.RS_Slogan: A town that can't be shaded any hue.
Pallet Town.Emerald_Slogan: A town that can't be shaded any hue.
Pallet Town.HGSS_Slogan: The Ravaged Town of the Past
Pallet Town.ORAS_Slogan: A town that can't be shaded any hue.

Pewter City.GSC_Slogan: A Historical City Where the Past Meets the Present
Pewter City.RS_Slogan: The bright and shiny city of fun!
Pewter City.Emerald_Slogan: The bright and shiny city of fun!
Pewter City.B2W2_Slogan: Sky Glittering with Flowers of Snow
Pewter City.XY_Slogan: A town where fluff dances on the wind.
Pewter City.ORAS_Slogan: The bright and shiny city of fun!

Pokémon Tower.RBY_Slogan: May the Souls of Pokémon Rest Easy
Pokémon Tower.BW_Slogan: Lit by the Flash of Lightning!

Saffron City.GSC_Slogan: The Festive City of Opulent Charm
Saffron City.XY_Slogan: A kind, sweet, and exquisite city.

Vermilion City.RS_Slogan: Where the morning sun smiles upon the waters.
Vermilion City.Emerald_Slogan: Where the morning sun smiles upon the waters.
Vermilion City.ORAS_Slogan: Where the morning sun smiles upon the waters.

Viridian City.GSC_Slogan: May the Souls Of Pokémon Rest Easy

Bike Shop.RS_Slogan: The city probing the integration of nature and science.
Bike Shop.Emerald_Slogan: The city probing the integration of nature and science.
Bike Shop.B2W2_Slogan: Lit by the Flash of Lightning!
Bike Shop.ORAS_Slogan: The city probing the integration of nature and science.

Slogan.GSC_Slogan: The World is a Cycle Path!
Slogan.HGSS_Slogan: The World is a Cycling Path!

Volt Tackle.Requirement: After defeating Reporter Rita and receiving Pikanium Z

Lavender Town.Area Description: Located in a house south of Mr. Fuji's house.
Lavender Town.Point Description: Allows the player to change the nicknames of their Pokémon, as long as they are the original Trainer.

Fuchsia City.Area Description: Located in the house next to the Pokémon Center.
Fuchsia City.Point Description: Makes a Pokémon forget a move they know.

Indigo Plateau.Area Description: Located in the Pokémon League lobby.
Indigo Plateau.Point Description: Exchanges a Heart Scale in order to remind a Pokémon of a move the Pokémon could learn by leveling up or special moves (Such as Egg Moves).

Blackthorn City.Area Description: Located in the house west of the Poké Mart.
Blackthorn City.Point Description: Exchanges a Heart Scale in order to remind a Pokémon of a move the Pokémon could learn by leveling up.

Slateport City.Area Description: Located in a house south of the Battle Tent.
Slateport City.Point Description: Allows the player to change the nicknames of their Pokémon, as long as they are the original Trainer.

Fallarbor Town.Point Description: Exchanges a Heart Scale in order to remind a Pokémon of a move the Pokémon could learn by leveling up or special moves (Such as Egg Moves).

Battle Frontier.Area Description: Located near the Pokémon Center in the group of buildings south of the Battle Tower.

Four Island.Point Description: Can turn in two of the player's Pokémon to be raised. If the two Pokémon are compatibile to breed with eachother they will after a time produce an Egg containing a Pokémon. Pokémon in the Day Care gains one experience point per step the player takes. Withdrawing a Pokémon costs 100 Pokémon Dollar plus an additional 100 Pokémon Dollar for each level the Pokémon gained while in the Day Care.

Eterna City.Area Description: Located inside Eterna Condominiums, first floor.
Eterna City.Point Description: Allows the player to change the nicknames of their Pokémon, as long as they are the original Trainer.

Solaceon Town.Point Description: Can turn in two of the player's Pokémon to be raised. If the two Pokémon are compatibile to breed with eachother they will after a time produce an Egg containing a Pokémon. Pokémon in the Day Care gains one experience point per step the player takes. Withdrawing a Pokémon costs 100 Pokémon Dollar plus an additional 100 Pokémon Dollar for each level the Pokémon gained while in the Day Care.

Pastoria City.Area Description: Located in the house northeast of the Poké Mart.
Pastoria City.Point Description: Exchanges a Heart Scale in order to remind a Pokémon of a move the Pokémon could learn by leveling up.

Canalave City.Area Description: Located in the house south of Pokémon Center.
Canalave City.Point Description: Makes a Pokémon forget a move they know.

Survival Area.Area Description: Located next to the Pokémon Center, the top right building.

Frontier Access.Area Description: Located on the north-western side of town, south of entry to Battle Frontier.

Castelia City.Area Description: Located inside the Medal Office building.
Castelia City.Point Description: Allows the player to change the nicknames of their Pokémon, as long as they are the original Trainer.

Mistralton City.Area Description: Located in the house east of the Pokémon Center.
Mistralton City.Point Description: Exchanges a Heart Scale in order to remind a Pokémon of a move the Pokémon could learn by leveling up.

White Forest.Area Description: Located in the south-western side of the forest.

Victory Road.Area Description: Located near entrance from Route 23's side.

Lumiose City.Area Description: Located in the Magenta Plaza section.

Camphrier Town.Point Description: Allows the player to change the nicknames of their Pokémon, as long as they are the original Trainer.

Dendemille Town.Area Description: Located in the house northeast of the Pokémon Center.
Dendemille Town.Point Description: Exchanges a Heart Scale in order to remind a Pokémon of a move the Pokémon could learn by leveling up or special moves (Such as Egg Moves).

Anistar City.Point Description: Describes a Pokémon's experiences with its current Trainer and original Trainer.

Route 1.Area Description: Located in Hau'oli Outskirts, southwest of the player's house.

Hau'oli City.Area Description: Located inside the Hau'oli Shopping Mall.
Hau'oli City.Point Description: Allows the player to maximize a Level 100 Pokémon's specific Individual Value stat in exchange for a Bottle Cap, or all Individual Value stats in exchange for a Gold Bottle Cap. Only available after becoming the Champion.

Route 2.Area Description: Located on the north of the western grass field, near the entrance to Accumula Town.
Route 2.Point Description: Has a 20% chance to contain a Pokémon with their hidden ability, and an 80% chance to contain an item. After the player walks 256 steps each empty Hidden Grotto has a 5% (can be increased by 5%, 10%, 15%, and 50% with the Hidden Grotto Pass Power) chance to regenerate a Pokémon or item.

Heahea City.Point Description: Allows the player to change the nicknames of their Pokémon, as long as they are the original Trainer.

Route 5.Point Description: Allows the player to maximize a Level 100 Pokémon's specific Individual Value stat in exchange for a Bottle Cap, or all Individual Value stats in exchange for a Gold Bottle Cap. Only available after becoming the Champion.

Tapu Village.Area Description: Located in the middle of the village.

Mount Lanakila.Point Description: Makes Eevee evolve into Glaceon if leveled up near the rock.

Wedgehurst.Point Description: Allows the player to change the nicknames of their Pokémon, as long as they are the original Trainer.

Meetup Spot (Wild Area).Area Description: Located inside the Wild Area Station.

Motostoke.Area Description: Located inside the Upper Tier Pokémon Center.
Motostoke.Point Description: Allows the player to change the nicknames of their Pokémon, as long as they are the original Trainer.

Turffield.Point Description: Allows the player to change the nicknames of their Pokémon, as long as they are the original Trainer.

Hulbury.Point Description: Allows the player to change the nicknames of their Pokémon, as long as they are the original Trainer.

Hammerlocke.Area Description: Located inside the southern Pokémon Center.
Hammerlocke.Point Description: Allows the player to change the nicknames of their Pokémon, as long as they are the original Trainer.

Stow-on-Side.Point Description: Allows the player to change the nicknames of their Pokémon, as long as they are the original Trainer.

Circhester.Point Description: Allows the player to change the nicknames of their Pokémon, as long as they are the original Trainer.

Spikemuth.Point Description: Allows the player to change the nicknames of their Pokémon, as long as they are the original Trainer.

Wyndon.Area Description: Located inside the southern Pokémon Center.
Wyndon.Point Description: Allows the player to change the nicknames of their Pokémon, as long as they are the original Trainer.

Slippery Slope (Crown Tundra).Area Description: Located inside the Crown Tundra Station.

Two Island.Area Description: Located in the house next to the Joyful Game Corner.
Two Island.Point Description: Exchanges 2x TinyMushroom or a Big Mushroom in order to remind a Pokémon of a move the Pokémon could learn by leveling up.

Agate Village.Point Description: Can turn in one of the player's Pokémon to be raised. Pokémon in the Day Care gains one experience point per step the player takes. Withdrawing a Pokémon costs 100 Pokémon Dollar plus an additional 100 Pokémon Dollar for each level the Pokémon gained while in the Day Care.

Goldenrod City.Area Description: Located in a house north of the Magnet Train station.
Goldenrod City.Point Description: Allows the player to change the nicknames of their Pokémon, as long as they are the original Trainer.

Lilycove City.Point Description: Describes a Pokémon's experiences with its current Trainer and original Trainer.

Mt. Battle.Area Description: Located in the lobby, man on the bottom bench on the right.
Mt. Battle.Point Description: Exchanges 1,000 Poké Coupons in order to remind a Pokémon of a move the Pokémon could learn by leveling up.

Pokémon World Tournament.Point Description: Exchanges a Heart Scale in order to remind a Pokémon of a move the Pokémon could learn by leveling up.

Route 217.Area Description: Located on the easternmost part where the blizzard is very rough.
Route 217.Point Description: Makes Eevee evolve into Glaceon if leveled up near the rock.

Twist Mountain.Point Description: Makes Eevee evolve into Glaceon if leveled up near the rock.

Frost Cavern.Area Description: Located deep within the cave, requires Surf to access.
Frost Cavern.Point Description: Makes Eevee evolve into Glaceon if leveled up near the rock.

Shoal Cave.Area Description: Located on the lowest floor, accessible only when the tide is low.
Shoal Cave.Point Description: Makes Eevee evolve into Glaceon if leveled up near the rock.

Mount Coronet.Point Description: Makes Magneton evolve into Magnezone, or Nosepass evolve into Probopass if leveled up in the area.

Chargestone Cave.Point Description: Makes Magneton evolve into Magnezone, or Nosepass evolve into Probopass if leveled up in the area.

Route 13.Area Description: Located at the top of the stairs towards the entrance to Giant Chasm.
Route 13.Point Description: Has a 20% chance to contain a Pokémon with their hidden ability, and an 80% chance to contain an item. After the player walks 256 steps each empty Hidden Grotto has a 5% (can be increased by 5%, 10%, 15%, and 50% with the Hidden Grotto Pass Power) chance to regenerate a Pokémon or item.

New Mauville.Point Description: Makes Magneton evolve into Magnezone, or Nosepass evolve into Probopass if leveled up in the area.

Blush Mountain.Point Description: Makes Magneton evolve into Magnezone, Nosepass evolve into Probopass, or Charjabug evolve into Vikavolt if leveled up in the area.

Vast Pony Canyon.Point Description: Makes Magneton evolve into Magnezone, Nosepass evolve into Probopass, or Charjabug evolve into Vikavolt if leveled up in the area.

Eterna Forest.Area Description: Located on the southwestern section, to the west of a formation of tress that resembles a sideways L.
Eterna Forest.Point Description: Makes Eevee evolve into Leafeon if leveled up near the rock.

Pinwheel Forest.Point Description: Has a 20% chance to contain a Pokémon with their hidden ability, and an 80% chance to contain an item. After the player walks 256 steps each empty Hidden Grotto has a 5% (can be increased by 5%, 10%, 15%, and 50% with the Hidden Grotto Pass Power) chance to regenerate a Pokémon or item.

Route 20.Area Description: Located in the first area from Snowbelle City's entrance.
Route 20.Point Description: Makes Eevee evolve into Leafeon if leveled up near the rock.

Petalburg Woods.Area Description: Located on the northeast section, requires Cut to access.
Petalburg Woods.Point Description: Makes Eevee evolve into Leafeon if leveled up near the rock.

Lush Jungle.Area Description: Located on the north section, directly north and slightly east of where the player enters.
Lush Jungle.Point Description: Makes Eevee evolve into Leafeon if leveled up near the rock.

Cinnabar Lab.Point Description: Can ressurrect Kabuto from a Dome Fossil, Omanyte from a Helix Fossil, or Aerodactyl from a Old Amber.

Pewter Museum of Science.Point Description: Can ressurrect Kabuto from a Dome Fossil, Omanyte from a Helix Fossil, Aerodactyl from a Old Amber, Lileep from a Root Fossil, Anorith from a Claw Fossil, Cranidos from a Skull Fossil, or Shieldon from a Armor Fossil.

Devon Corporation.Point Description: Can ressurrect Kabuto from a Dome Fossil, Omanyte from a Helix Fossil, Aerodactyl from a Old Amber, Lileep from a Root Fossil, Anorith from a Claw Fossil, Cranidos from a Skull Fossil, Shieldon from a Armor Fossil, Tirtouga from a Cover Fossil, Archen from a Plume Fossil, Tyrunt from a Jaw Fossil, or Amaura from a Sail Fossil.

Fossil Restoration Center.Point Description: Can ressurrect Kabuto from a Dome Fossil, Omanyte from a Helix Fossil, Aerodactyl from a Old Amber, Lileep from a Root Fossil, Anorith from a Claw Fossil, Cranidos from a Skull Fossil, Shieldon from a Armor Fossil, Tirtouga from a Cover Fossil, Archen from a Plume Fossil, Tyrunt from a Jaw Fossil, or Amaura from a Sail Fossil.

Route 6.Point Description: Has a 20% chance to contain a Pokémon with their hidden ability, and an 80% chance to contain an item. After the player walks 256 steps each empty Hidden Grotto has a 5% (can be increased by 5%, 10%, 15%, and 50% with the Hidden Grotto Pass Power) chance to regenerate a Pokémon or item.

Route 34.Point Description: Can turn in two of the player's Pokémon to be raised. If the two Pokémon are compatibile to breed with eachother they will after a time produce an Egg containing a Pokémon. Pokémon in the Day Care gains one experience point per step the player takes. Withdrawing a Pokémon costs 100 Pokémon Dollar plus an additional 100 Pokémon Dollar for each level the Pokémon gained while in the Day Care.

Route 117.Point Description: Can turn in two of the player's Pokémon to be raised. If the two Pokémon are compatibile to breed with eachother they will after a time produce an Egg containing a Pokémon. Pokémon in the Day Care gains one experience point per step the player takes.
